chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Complete batterer's intervention program.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher L Scott in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 25 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  This sentence may be served in Racine County.  Defendant to report in on 09/28/2015.
As to count 2:
  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 80 days in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with the victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV and DNA surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
Probation may be transferred to Racine County.
If needed, the agent can contact the court for a review hearing.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
State Subpoena

As to Count 1 amended and Count 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered the jury trial date of 09/09/2015 vacated. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.

Defendant Christopher L Scott in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in Court for final pre-trial. Defense wishes to resolve the case with a plea. Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Obstructing an Officer, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.41(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List.

Defendant Christopher L Scott in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Defense counsel recently appointed, requestd an adjounment. Court GRANTED adjournment. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Christopher L Scott in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Owen Piotrowski for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Matthew Ours-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher L Scott in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Christopher L Scott in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty to MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.
